Professional Summary

Ebrahim (EB) Khiyami is a cloud technologist and architect with 15+ years of experience transforming businesses through innovative cloud solutions. He specializes in helping startups and enterprises build scalable, secure, and cost-efficient cloud workloads while driving digital transformation initiatives.

As a Cloud Optimization Solutions Architect at AWS, EB focuses on enterprise-scale cloud migrations, optimization strategies, and generative AI implementations. He works with customers to evaluate and improve their cloud architecture health, mitigate operational risks, and maximize performance while reducing costs.

• Gen-AI Well-Architected Review Solution: AI-powered solution automating Well-Architected reviews across all 6 pillars, improving efficiency by 80%.

• Migration Lens Well-Architected Framework: Co-authored official AWS framework enabling 100s of customers to identify migration risks and implement best practices.

• AWS Disaster Recovery Services Enhancements: Developed cross-cloud DR solutions protecting GCP and Azure workloads using AWS as recovery site.

• AWS Migration Acceleration Program Automator: Built automation tools streamlining cloud migrations for 1000s of customers, reducing time and complexity.

His diverse background includes serving as an ERP escalation engineer at Microsoft and leading enterprise resource planning implementations across finance, manufacturing, and education sectors, providing him with deep understanding of complex business systems and transformation challenges.

EB is a published author and prolific contributor to technical whitepapers, industry blog posts, and internal AWS playbooks. He holds a B.S. in Computer Engineering and two Master's degrees in IT Management and Enterprise Resource Planning, combining technical expertise with business acumen.

Beyond his professional achievements, EB is a dedicated mentor in the technology community, a father of three boys, and enjoys balancing his technical pursuits with family time and creative hobbies.

</div>

What I do today

As a Solutions Architect at Amazon Web Services (AWS), I support the Cloud Optimization team, which owns AWS best practices, the Well-Architected framework, and optimization tools. Working as part of a global team, I ensure customers maximize their AWS investment across three key domains: Cloud Migration & Transformation, Cloud Optimization, and Generative AI.

Migration has been my specialty for years, helping organizations transition between data centers and to AWS. Since 2023, I've been deeply involved in AWS Generative AI initiatives, exploring how it enhances efficiency for customers and teams. Examples of this work include my YouTube Summarizer, Gen AI Well-Architected Review, and Chat with your AWS Bill solutions.

My Approach

I serve as a bridge between complex technical concepts and practical business solutions, helping customers understand and navigate technology to transform their operations. My communication spans multiple channels: technical writing, public speaking, hands-on coding, building proof-of-concepts, LinkedIn engagement, and occasional illustration.

My job as I see it. I'm the bridge. illustration credits: me

A Week in My Life

A typical week includes a combination of these activities:

Customer Meetings

Optimization, Generative AI, Migration discussions

Meeting Preparation

Research and planning for customer engagements

Internal Work

Meetings, documentation, advocating for customers

Continuous Learning

I try not to pass a day without learning something new

Content Creation

Writing, reviewing, raising the bar

Building

Workshops, conference talks, blog posts

Mentoring

Amazon folks during work hours, outside Amazon folks on weekends

Office Commute

I live in Dallas, TX. I commute 90 minutes/day

I focus on work that energizes me. When passionate about a project, I maintain a flexible approach that may extend beyond traditional hours while preserving work-life balance. This passion-driven methodology ensures high-quality outcomes and sustained innovation.

Background

My technology journey began in 2000 when I enrolled in the School of Computer Engineering. During my studies, I gained practical experience through freelance work—fixing computers and printers, and later teaching IT courses. This combination of academic learning and hands-on problem-solving built both my technical skills and confidence in the field.

After graduation, my first full-time position was as a Network and System Administrator, which launched a diverse career spanning multiple roles and industries. Over the years, I've evolved through various positions: technician, developer, support engineer, architect, project manager, and entrepreneur, each role adding depth to my technical expertise and leadership capabilities.

Beyond my professional life, I'm a dedicated father of three boys, an active mentor in the technology community, and enjoy creative pursuits as a hobbyist. This balance between technical excellence and personal fulfillment drives my approach to both work and life.

A driving break at the White Mountains, New Hampshire, 2023. Credits: my wife
